country.name: Saint Barthélemy
country.overview: Saint Barthelemy, a French-speaking Caribbean island commonly known as St. Barts, is known for its white-sand beaches and designer shops. The capital, Gustavia, encircling a yacht-filled harbor, has high-end restaurants and historical attractions like the Wall House, whose exhibits highlight the island’s Swedish colonial era. Perched above town is 17th-century Fort Karl, looking out over popular Shell Beach.

geography.location_description: Caribbean, island between the Caribbean Sea and the North Atlantic Ocean; located in the Leeward Islands (northern) group; Saint Barthelemy lies east of the US Virgin Islands
geography.area_note: less than one-eighth the size of Washington, DC
geography.climate: tropical, with practically no variation in temperature; has two seasons (dry and humid)
geography.terrain: hilly, almost completely surrounded by shallow-water reefs, with plentiful beaches
geography.notes: a 1,200-hectare marine nature reserve, the Reserve Naturelle, is made up of five zones around the island that form a network to protect the island's coral reefs, seagrass, and endangered marine species

languages.name: Guadeloupean Creole French
languages.maps: Creole Languages of the Eastern Caribbean
